DOC.brief_summary: For woman fetus breech presentation , early ECV ( 34 0/7 35 week 6/7 day ) versus delay ECV ( 37 week 0/7 day ) increase decrease likelihood cesarean section ( CS ) ?
DOC.brief_title: Early External Cephalic Version ( ECV ) 2 Trial
DOC.detailed_description: Primary Outcomes : Rate Caesarean section Secondary Outcomes : Rate preterm birth Other Outcomes : admission neonatal intensive care unit â‰¥ 24 hour , perinatal neonatal mortality serious neonatal morbidity , serious fetal complication , maternal death serious maternal morbidity , non-cephalic presentation birth , woman 's view , health care cost . The Data Coordination study carry Maternal , Infant Reproductive Health Research Unit Sunnybrook Women 's College Health Sciences Centre .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Women breech presentation 2 . A live singleton fetus 3 . Gestational age 33 week 0 day 35 week 6 day 1 . Contraindications ECV ( e.g . fetal heart rate abnormality , abruptio placenta , major lifethreatening fetal anomaly , uterine anomaly , hyperextend fetal head , rupture membrane , severe oligohydramnios , severe polyhydramnios ) 2 . Contraindications early ECV ( e.g . increase risk preterm labour [ past history preterm labour previous pregnancy ] , increase risk abruptio placenta [ maternal hypertension ] ) 3 . Contraindications labour vaginal delivery ( e.g . placenta previa , previous classical CS ) 4 . Women plan delivery CS fetus turn cephalic 5 . Women plan vaginal delivery fetus remain breech 6 . Women increase risk unstable lie ( eg . grand multiparity ) 7 . Previous participation EECV2 Trial
